alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 17 at 1:14PM MDT until June 17 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western and Northern Elbert County in east central Colorado... * Until 500 PM MDT. * At 114 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Elbert, Kiowa, Agate and Fondis. This includes the following streams and drainages... Wolf Creek, West Bijou Creek, Muddy Creek, First Creek, Agate Creek, Key Creek, Comanche Creek, Water Gulch, West Kiowa Creek, Hay Gulch, Spring Branch, Rattlesnake Creek, Kiowa Creek, Wilson Creek, East Cherry Creek, Middle Bijou Creek, Dry Creek, Gopher Creek, East Bijou Creek and Running Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
